data.title: Swiss Cantons A
data.text:
World Statesmen.org HOME > return to Switzerland >>

Swiss Cantons A-F

Cantons:Aargau - Appenzell Ausserrhoden - Appenzell Innerrhoden - Basel-Stadt - Basel-Land - Bern - Bern city - Fribourg - Former Cantons: Appenzell - Baden - Basel - Fricktal - Oberland - Former Associated Member: Biel (Bienne) -

Party abbreviations: DM = Die Mitte/Le Centre/Alleanza del Centro/Allianza dal Center (The Middle/Center Alliance, centrist, merger of CVP and BDP, est.1 Jan 2021); FDP = Freisinnig-Demokratische Partei der Schweiz/Parti Radical-Démocratique Suisse/Partito Liberale Radicale Svizzero (Freethinking-Democratic Party of Switzerland or predecessors, liberal, from 1 Jan 2009 named FDP.The Liberals [FDP.Die Liberalen/PLR.Les Libéraux-Radicaux], est.25 Feb 1894); GFL = Grünen Freien Liste (Green Free List, Bern ecologist, est.May 2006); GPS = Grüne Partei der Schweiz/Parti Ecologiste Suisse "Les VERT-E-S"/"I Verdi"  Partito Ecologista Svizzero/La Verda  Partida Ecologica Svizra (Green Party of Switzerland "Greens", ecologist, left wing, est.28 May 1983); LDP = Liberal-Demokratische Partei (Liberal Democratic Party, Basel regionalist, 1905-1978 named Liberal-demokratische Bürgerpartei [Liberal-Democratic Citizens' Party], est.1905); PCSI = Parti Chrétien Social-Indépendant (IndependentChristian Social Party, est.1956); SPS = Sozialdemokratische Partei der Schweiz/Parti Socialiste Suisse/Partito Socialista Svizzero (Social-Democratic Party of Switzerland, social-democratic, est.21 Oct 1888); SVP = Schweizerische Volkspartei/Union Démocratique du Centre/Unione Democratica del Centro/Partida Populara Svizra (Swiss People's Party/Democratic Union of the Center, conservative, Eurosceptic, split from FDP; named 1936-22 Sep 1971 Peasants', Business, and Citizens' Party, est.23 Dec 1936); - Former parties: Ant = Antirevisionisten/Patriotischer Verein (Anti-Revisionists/Patriotic Association);BDP = Bürgerlich-Demokratische Partei Schweiz/Parti Bourgeois Démocratique Suisse/Partito Borghese Democratico Svizzera (Citizens' Democratic Party of Switzerland, center-right, split from SVP, 1 Nov 2008-31 Dec 2020, merged into DM); BGB = Bauern-, Gewerbe- und Bürgerpartei (Farmers', Trades and Citizens' Party, 23 Dec 1936-1971, merged into SVP); Con = Conservative; CVP = Christlichdemokratische Volkspartei der Schweiz/Parti Démocrate-Chrétien/Partito Popolare Democratico Svizzero/Partida Cristiandemocratica Svizra (Christian Democratic People's Party, christian-democratic; named 1881-1894 Catholic People's Party, 1894-1912 Catholic People's Party, 1912-1957 Conservative People's Party, 1957-12 Dec 1970 Conservative Christian Social People's, 18 Jul 1881-31 Dec 2020, merged into DM); FBP = Fortschrittliche Bürgerpartei (Progressive Citizens' Party, 1911-1937, merged into BGB, but in 1957 joined Liberaldemokratischen Partei [Liberal Democratic Party]); LPS = Liberale Partei der Schweiz/Parti Libéral Suisse/Partito Liberale Svizzero/Partida Liberala Svizra (Liberal Party of Switzerland or predecessors, liberal, 8 Oct 1913-1 Jan 2009, merged with FDP; a separate Basel-Stadt branch remained until 2013); Rev = Revisionisten (Revisionist/Revision Association); VF = Vereinigte Freisinnige der Stadt Bern (United Liberals of the City of Bern, 18811895, merged into FDP)

Aargau

Mar - 26 Mar 1798 (de facto)

26 Mar - 18 Apr 1798

Adopted 20 Apr 1803/

2 Jul 1930

922 Karolingian county part of Burgundy.

15 Jul 1291 Aargau (Argovia) a Habsburg possession.

16 Apr 1415 Occupied by Swiss Confederation.

19 May 1415 Aargau a common (gemeine herrschaft) possession of the Swiss

Confederation, core territory annexed by Bern, it is

administered as two oberamter - Aarburg, and from 1444 Lenzburg,

under a Landvogt (see under Swiss territories).

10 Mar 1798 - 18 Apr 1798 French occupation.

18 Apr 1798 Incorporated into Helvetic Republic (Kanton Aargau).

10 Mar 1803 Kanton Aargau established as member of the Swiss

Confederation.

Baden

1264 Habsburg possession. 22 Jul 1415 County of Baden (Grafschaft Baden) pledged to the Swiss Confederation (see under Swiss territories). 18 Dec 1415 Common possession of Confederation (Gemeine Herrschaft),

administered from 1712 by Zürich, Bern and Glarus. Mar 1798 - Apr 1798 French occupation.19 Mar 1798 Swiss Cantons renounce sovereignty over Baden. 11 Apr 1798 Kanton Baden established within the Helvetic Republic. 29 Jul 1802 Incorporated into Kanton Aargau.

Regierungskommissär 22 Mar 1798 - 1798 Kastor Joseph Dominik Baldinger (b. 1760 - d. 1810)

23 Apr 1798 - 30 Apr 1798 N. Honegger (did not take office)

30 Apr 1798 - 14 Jun 1799 Heinrich Johann Nepomuk Weber (b. 1767 - d. 1847)

14 Jun 1799 - 25 Sep 1799 Johann Kaspar Pfenninger (b. 1760 - d. 1838)

25 Sep 1799 - 29 Nov 1799 Alois Gut + Franz Adam Gubler

(acting)

29 Nov 1799 - 29 Jul 1802 Johann Jakob Scheuchzer (b. 1734 - d. 1810)

Freie Ämter, Ober Freie Ämter and Unter Freie Ämter: see under Swiss territories

Fricktal

c.1530 - 1803

1491 Habsburg possession, within Vorderösterreich (Further Austria),as Amt Frick (Frick district)(see under Swiss territories). 23 Apr 1799 - 1802 Occupied by France. 6 Jan 1802 Provisional government declared, Austrian administration terminated. 9 Feb 1802 By the Treaty of Lunèville, Austria cedes to France the Fricktal

and other Austrian possessions on the left-bank of the Rhine. 20 Feb 1802Kanton Fricktal 13 Aug 1802 Incorporated into Helvetic Republic. 19 Feb 1803 Merged into Kanton Aargau.

Statthalter 6 Jan 1802 - 22 Sep 1802 Sebastian Fahrländer (b. 1768 - d. 1841) (in dissidence to 4 Oct 1802, briefly restored 3-27 Nov 1802) 22 Sep 1802 - 3 Dec 1802 Johann Karl Fetzer (b. 1768 - d. 1847) Regierungsstatthalter 3 Dec 1802 - 19 Feb 1803 Johann Karl Fetzer (s.a.)

Appenzell

c.1403 - 1597

10.. Part of the lands of the Abbot of Sankt Gallen as abbatis cella

(cell/estates of the abbot).

1401 Appenzell enters into an alliance with the city of Sankt Gallen.

1403 Alliance with the Canton of Schwyz.

May 1403 Appenzeller uprising establishes an administration in Appenzell separate from Abbot of Sankt Gallen. 1408 By treaty the Abbot of Sankt Gallen gives up his seigniorial rights

over Appenzell, retaining certain revenues.

24 Nov 1411 Appenzell makes an alliance (Schutzverwandte) with the Swiss Confederation.

15 Nov 1452 Appenzell becomes an associate member (Zugewandter Ort) of the Confederation.17 Dec 1513 Appenzell becomes a full member (Stand) of the Confederation. 8 Sep 1597 Split into "half-cantons" Appenzell Ausserrhoden and Appenzell Innerrhoden.

Basel

c.1385-1798, 1803-1833 1798

26 Aug 1833 - 7 Dec 1969

c.346 Castrum Rauracense becomes the seat of a bishop.

374 Basel documented as Basilea or Basilia..... Part of Bishopric of Basel (Hochstift Basel)7th cent. The bishop moves to Basel from Castrum Rauracense.

917 The Magyars destroy Basel.

1032 Part of Prince-Bishopric of Basel.

18 Oct 1356 Basel major earthquake followed by a fire destroys the city.

Mar 1376 - 9 Jul 1376 Basel placed under ban by the Holy Roman Empire at the

urging of Duke Leopold III von Habsburg.

1 Aug 1386 Free City of Basel (Freistädte Basel).18 Aug 1461 Country-territories annexed by the free city. 13 Jul 1501 Stadt Basel (City of Basel) becomes a full member (Stand) of

the Confederation.10 Jul 1528 Bishop is definitely ousted from control over the city and moves

to Porrentruy (see under Jura).20 Jan 1798 Freistand Basel (or Freistaat Basel). 18 Apr 1798 Incorporated into Helvetic Republic (Kanton Basel). 10 Mar 1803 Kanton Basel (restored). 26 Aug 1833 Split intoBasel-Stadt and Basel-Land.

Basel-Land

Adopted 1833/1 Apr 1947

29 May 1832 Regierungsrat instituted (conditional separation). 26 Aug 1833 Kanton Basel-Landschaft (definitive separation). 1 Jun 1958 People of Basel agree to the "popular initiative regarding the

two half-cantons of Basel."

7 Dec 1969 Referendum rejects union with Basel-Stadt.

28 Sep 2014 Referendum again rejects union with Basel-Stadt by 68.3%.

Bern (Berne)

Adopted c.1375/1813

May 1191 Bern founded, within Burgundy. 18 Feb 1218 Bern reverts to the Empire when the ruling family dies out.15 Jan 1274 Imperial Free City of Bern (Reichsstadt Bern).May 1255 - 1256 Administered by Savoy (advocatus Ulrich von Wimpfen). 6 Mar 1353 Bern becomes a full member (Stand) of the Confederation(Stadt und Republik Bern).

12 Apr 1798 - 10 Mar 1803 Incorporated into the Helvetic Republic (divided into Kanton Bern and Kanton Oberland to 29 Jul 1802).Apr 1803 City and Republic of Bern (Stadt und Republik Bern)(restored)

(including Bernese Jura[former Bishopric of Basel]). 1 Jan 1979 Secession of Jura as a separate canton.

18 Jun 2017 Moutier votes to join Canton of Jura by 51.7% (to be effected 2026).
